alert.note: Alert for Admiralty Island; Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait; City and Borough of Juneau; City and Borough of Sitka; City and Borough of Yakutat; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 13 at 6:13AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...PERIODS OF HEAVY RAIN CONTINUING INTO FRIDAY MORNING... A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE EASTERN GULF OF ALASKA WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE NORTHWEST ALONG THE COAST THROUGH EARLY FRIDAY. PRECIPITATION AMOUNTS ACROSS THE REGION SO FAR HAVE BEEN AROUND 1.5 INCHES. PERIODS OF HEAVY RAIN WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE OVER THE AREA THIS MORNING WITH AN ADDITIONAL 0.5 TO 1.5 INCHES. THE LATEST SATELLITE RAIN RATE VALUES OVER THE EASTERN GULF OF ALASKA, THAT WILL MOVE OVER THE PANHANDLE NW OF CROSS SOUND AND GLACIER BAY, RANGE BETWEEN 0.15 TO 0.25 INCHES PER HOUR. RIVERS AND STREAMS HAVE BEGUN TO RESPOND TO THE HEAVY PRECIPITATION THAT HAS ALREADY FALLEN, ALTHOUGH RISES ABOVE MINOR FLOOD STAGE ARE STILL NOT ANTICIPATED AT THIS TIME. STAY TUNED FOR FURTHER UPDATES AND INFORMATION FROM THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE ON THIS DEVELOPING STORM SYSTEM INTO FRIDAY MORNING.
